title: riot pay2win urf pass.
body: gj riot, you made pay2win pass

replies.body:
Doesn't it only give an additional re-roll? And the max reroll remains at 2?

How is it pay to win if all you're getting is rerolls and people who don't buy can still have the same number of rerolls as you that game?
of course its pay to win. you have ab etter chance to get someone and you have unlimited of it (every game 1) there's no way to get this without paying' therefor pay2win
If I have 2 re-rolls going into an URF without paying, will a person with the pass have more re-rolls than me?
of course. he gets free reroll every game

No. Since the max amount of rerolls is still two. The most that anyone can have going into the match is **TWO**. If I entered the match with two re-rolls, and a person with the pass has two re-rolls, we both have the same number of rerolls.

Therefor, the person with the pass had zero extra rerolls over me.

you have 2 rerolls. UNTIL YOU USE BOTH but they get 1 reroll EVERY GAME so they're never out of rerolls, there for having pay2win (of course it they have 2 rerolls they wont get any, but if they use one next game they will get another, and you wont)

I ask again,

Will a person with a pass have more rolls than me if I enter the lobby with two rerolls (which is an easy thing to accomplish)?

The answer is no. They have no advantage over me even if you consider having 1 additional reroll as some sort of advantage.

like i said just 1 min ago. but ok they wont.  but if theyuse one they will have another one next game. there for they always have a better chance to get something better. you use 2 rerolls wand you wont have anymore. THEY WILL PAY2WIN
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uH0hikcwjIA

> [{quoted}](name=Kai Guy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=000100000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-28T21:40:59.576+0000)
>
> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uH0hikcwjIA

Why can't you accept that you're wrong?

Because pay to win is a term us gamers coined for shitty games that literally prevent F2P accounts from ever achieving success. Items? PAY WALL. Top tier champion? Fking Pay wall. Best classes? Pay wall.

The term does not have any meaning when used incorrectly. For example, its not for expansions. Like no ones OMG GUILD WARS WAS PAY TO WIN BECUSE NEW CLASS IN EXPANSION/ NEW SKILLS.  Yea a lot of new builds could be strong. Missing out on a good class combo sucked. But you could wreck folks in PvP with out it.

Leauge having the occasional account power you can get with $?  Sorry that's been a part of the game from season 1.  Remember runes?  Turns out having multiple rune pages made your account better because you could in lobby change them, having presets for multiple matchups across every champion you mained?  That's an edge vs some one who cant.


So shure. Rerolls are an edge. Call it pay for an advantage or edge. Its not pay to win because the games literally not un-winnableif you vs some one with the pass.

Use the term right. Riots got one of the better F2P Models in the industry.

Pay for advantages? Leagues always had that. If your skill doesn't back it up your gonna still lose because your bad. If you don't pay for it and your good you still win. Nuff said.

And hey if you chose to define Pay to win as any time a game gives an advantage for spending $?  That's 100% all of everything with F2P models that also has a $ currency as well.
Your welcome to have that as your opinion, how ever we would have low use for the term F2P  because due to overlap all the games would meet the definition for P2W.

So shure spark outrage. OMG AN ADVANTAGE!  It does not remove your skills impact. Your not seeing a pay wall, they don't get gross in game advantages. For their account? Yea it helps. For any 1 independent game? 0 assurances it will help you at all.

Rage about Riot going PAY TO WIN.  When by your definition the games been that way from its first years. Talk about riot selling their soul to china, despite Ten-cent being a 2011 event, well be for most y'all even started playing. Make pointless noise about a RNG game modes balance and how unfair it is for extra rerolls to be purchased.

Any one who has experience with pay to win games is going to laugh at ya. Because some games are literally unwinnable with out $ interaction. You cant make a top list with out paying for special units, high tier buildings, special ability's, speed ups, or even get locked out of playing a stage because you wont spend $.

That's the definition of pay to win for most of everybody. You have to PAY... or you wont win vs the guys who do.

Feel free to have your own perception and definition. I very clearly don't. We will not see eye to eye on it. Don't waste my or your time trying to argue it.

Tldr. I'm not wrong and good luck with life each time you attempt arguing your perception > some one else's Perception.
TL;DR. You were wrong, though, so I'm going to assume all of that was just to say that you admit you're wrong.

If you want to make a low effort response and show off your inability to refute my statements feel free to do so.

Look, Your welcome to just continue using the term wrong. I cant force you to change your perception or definition and you clearly never bothered to search what the term means.

> [{quoted}](name=Kai Guy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=0001000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-31T00:28:37.833+0000)
>
> If you want to make a low effort response and show off your inability to refute my statements feel free to do so.
> 
> Look, Your welcome to just continue using the term wrong. I cant force you to change your perception or definition and you clearly never bothered to search what the term means.

Forgive me for not wasting my time to read a wall of text that really only repeats the same idea over and over (and mocks anyone who would argue otherwise). 

I'm not "using it wrong"; it's as plain as day. That aside, it is furthermore perfectly logical to conclude that extra rerolls result in greater control over one's champion choice. It is likewise perfectly logical to conclude that greater control results in a statistically non-negligible strategic advantage (i.e., "often enough"). It is trivial to conclude that a strategic advantage results in more wins.

Ergo, pay-to-win. End of story. (Or are you really suggesting that it's unreasonable to shorten "pay-to-win-more-often-than-you-would-otherwise" to "pay-to-win"?)
TL;DR. You're still wrong.

I'm really not. But you guys can misuse the term for anything that gives $ to advantage if you want. I won't/can't stop you.  All that your doing is removing the value and meaning of it.


Carry on my low effort poster friend.
its only for that mode advantage if anything who cares its only a Mode where champs are broke due to cdr. plus its temporary
What do you mean by that? Last time i checked, you didn't have to pay for gameplay elements.
it isn't even random luck, you can buy a pass and have a better chance at getting a champ that is good in that mode. pay2win

> [{quoted}](name=Ńabi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-01-28T20:03:10.831+0000)
>
> it isn't even random luck, you can buy a pass and have a better chance at getting a champ that is good in that mode. pay2win

You get one reroll. While this should not exist (imho), it's not p2w, you have the same chance of getting OP character with each roll that the paying gamer has.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-28T20:07:07.003+0000)
>
> You get one reroll. While this should not exist (imho), it's not p2w, you have the same chance of getting OP character with each roll that the paying gamer has.

Getting better chance at an OP champion while theres no other way to get the same benefit without paying is the definition of pay to win dude.

> [{quoted}](name=Anime Fizz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=0000000000000001,timestamp=2019-01-28T23:25:55.858+0000)
>
> Getting better chance at an OP champion while theres no other way to get the same benefit without paying is the definition of pay to win dude.

It's not a better chance. It's just a reroll. You can get 2 champions in 3 rolls, mate. Unless there's some weird coding that prevents that, it should not be a big deal.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=00000000000000010000,timestamp=2019-01-28T23:29:15.810+0000)
>
> It's not a better chance. It's just a reroll. You can get 2 champions in 3 rolls, mate. Unless there's some weird coding that prevents that, it should not be a big deal.

Each individual roll doesn't have a better chance of giving you a strong champion, that's true.

But if you are allowed _more_ rolls overall, then the likelihood of getting a strong champ in the matches you play goes up. It's like buying more lottery tickets.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=000000000000000100000001,timestamp=2019-01-28T23:35:48.777+0000)
>
> Each individual roll doesn't have a better chance of giving you a strong champion, that's true.
> 
> But if you are allowed _more_ rolls overall, then the likelihood of getting a strong champ in the matches you play goes up. It's like buying more lottery tickets.

Likelihood of rolling terrible champions goes up too.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=0000000000000001000000010000,timestamp=2019-01-28T23:38:10.411+0000)
>
> Likelihood of rolling terrible champions goes up too.

If you get a terrible champ, you reroll, but if you get a strong champ, you play it and don't reroll.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=00000000000000010000000100000001,timestamp=2019-01-29T00:13:27.733+0000)
>
> If you get a terrible champ, you reroll, but if you get a strong champ, you play it and don't reroll.

Oh, for the love of... THEN PLAY ONE GAME WITH A RANDOM CHAMPION, AND YOU WILL GET YOUR REROLL.

Seriously, URF is not ranked.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=000000000000000100000001000000010000,timestamp=2019-01-29T00:54:34.948+0000)
>
> Oh, for the love of... THEN PLAY ONE GAME WITH A RANDOM CHAMPION, AND YOU WILL GET YOUR REROLL.
> 
> Seriously, URF is not ranked.

So you admit that you're wrong.

He is not. its MMR systems. you expect mismatches and impossible games. That not every round is fair.  It works of a law of large numbers to ensure that skill = placement.

A garbage player will be garbage even with extra rerolls.

A Strong player will remain strong not using them.

Please try and treat URF and ARAM as game modes that are competitive or balanced btw. Yes... that's why they exist. Because of good balance. 0 fun. Only competitive matches.... built from massive RNG.

You want to know how to REALLY dominate urf and Aram?

its not the re rolls. Make a smurf and only unlock the most broken heros for the game type so that your RNG on champions always favors you. You can do this 100% free btw no $ involved.

By far a stronger exploit then rerolls lol.

> [{quoted}](name=Kai Guy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=00000000000000010000000100000001000000010000,timestamp=2019-01-30T08:00:36.353+0000)
>
> He is not. its MMR systems. you expect mismatches and impossible games. That not every round is fair.  It works of a law of large numbers to ensure that skill = placement.
> 
> A garbage player will be garbage even with extra rerolls.
> 
> A Strong player will remain strong not using them.
> 
> Please try and treat URF and ARAM as game modes that are competitive or balanced btw. Yes... that's why they exist. Because of good balance. 0 fun. Only competitive matches.... built from massive RNG.
> 
> You want to know how to REALLY dominate urf and Aram?
> 
> its not the re rolls. Make a smurf and only unlock the most broken heros for the game type so that your RNG on champions always favors you. You can do this 100% free btw no $ involved.
> 
> By far a stronger exploit then rerolls lol.

Sorry, but he already admitted it.

That its an advantage? Yes it is. Does it meet the criteria for pay to win? No, that's not what the term is used for. Well, Apart from a few of you guys who don't seem to properly understand the very basic concept of pay to win. The advantage wont overcome skill. No amount of $ spent will magically make you a stronger player. Iron with the pass who can only play 2 champions with any skill wont start winning games from an extra reroll. He still will play iron.

Meanwhile In games with a Pay 2 win model your literally incapable of wins as a free user vs paying ones. Items, hero's, ability's. All Tiers above anything free players can access so the only way to compete is if you also spend $ on said items ability's and hero's.

But we have already established Dnsup you don't have the same description.  Looks like you feel that any advantage, even minor ones that wont replace skill impact = pay to win. In which case that's been league from season 1. Skins with animations that are harder to see are also Pay to win.

Because your definition for pay to win seems like it has 0 accounting for skill and its impact on the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Kai Guy,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=0000000000000001000000010000000100000001000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-31T00:38:29.396+0000)
>
> That its an advantage? Yes it is. Does it meet the criteria for pay to win? No, that's not what the term is used for. Well, Apart from a few of you guys who don't seem to properly understand the very basic concept of pay to win. The advantage wont overcome skill. No amount of $ spent will magically make you a stronger player. Iron with the pass who can only play 2 champions with any skill wont start winning games from an extra reroll. He still will play iron.
> 
> Meanwhile In games with a Pay 2 win model your literally incapable of wins as a free user vs paying ones. Items, hero's, ability's. All Tiers above anything free players can access so the only way to compete is if you also spend $ on said items ability's and hero's.
> 
> But we have already established Dnsup you don't have the same description.  Looks like you feel that any advantage, even minor ones that wont replace skill impact = pay to win. In which case that's been league from season 1. Skins with animations that are harder to see are also Pay to win.
> 
> Because your definition for pay to win seems like it has 0 accounting for skill and its impact on the game.

As I (and others) have [already pointed out](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/hfEnAr69-riot-pay2win-urf-pass?comment=00010000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000000) several times now, you're still getting it wrong.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=000000000000000100000001000000010000,timestamp=2019-01-29T00:54:34.948+0000)
>
> Oh, for the love of... THEN PLAY ONE GAME WITH A RANDOM CHAMPION, AND YOU WILL GET YOUR REROLL.
> 
> Seriously, URF is not ranked.

Meanwhile, your opponent who bought the pass and initially got a weak URF champ used their bonus reroll and perhaps got a good one.

"URF is not ranked" means that you do see the problem and realize it's P2W, but you think it's excusable because it's not in a certain mode.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=0000000000000001000000010000,timestamp=2019-01-28T23:38:10.411+0000)
>
> Likelihood of rolling terrible champions goes up too.

They can be exchanged freely. The bottom line is that the number of chances to "upgrade" to a strategic advantage increases with the number of rerolls. End of story.

> [{quoted}](name=GreenKnight,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=00000000000000010000,timestamp=2019-01-28T23:29:15.810+0000)
>
> It's not a better chance. It's just a reroll. You can get 2 champions in 3 rolls, mate. Unless there's some weird coding that prevents that, it should not be a big deal.

The more rerolls you have the better chance to have a better champion, mind blowing right?

5 players with the pass have 5 extra rerolls total against a team with no passes, and you're going to tell me this "doesnt matter at all" and "wont give them an advantage"?

Paying for rerolls on a random mode is paying to get a better champion, so paying to win.

> [{quoted}](name=Anime Fizz,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2019-01-28T23:30:41.812+0000)
>
> The more rerolls you have the better chance to have a better champion, mind blowing right?
> 
> 5 players with the pass have 5 extra rerolls total against a team with no passes, and you're going to tell me this "doesnt matter at all" and "wont give them an advantage"?
> 
> Paying for rerolls on a random mode is paying to get a better champion, so paying to win.

And then you roll terrible champions for this mode. For fucks sake, look at the fucking roster. How many of those could be considered OP?
of course its pay to win. you have ab etter chance to get someone and you have unlimited of it (every game 1) there's no way to get this without paying' therefor pay2win

> [{quoted}](name=Ńabi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-28T20:08:11.181+0000)
>
> of course its pay to win. you have ab etter chance to get someone and you have unlimited of it (every game 1) there's no way to get this without paying' therefor pay2win

Read what i wrote again. And then do it once more. Continue to do so until you understand what i mean.
Nice math. but if you have more chances your chances of getting something good are bigger. now Read what i wrote again. And then do it once more. Continue to do so until you understand what i mean.

> [{quoted}](name=Ńabi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-28T20:11:52.521+0000)
>
> Nice math. but if you have more chances your chances of getting something good are bigger. now Read what i wrote again. And then do it once more. Continue to do so until you understand what i mean.

You don't have more chances, ffs.
of course you do, what dont you understand? you get free rerolls. the average player do not get rerolls after 2, MORE CHANCES

> [{quoted}](name=Ńabi,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=00000000000000000000000000000000,timestamp=2019-01-28T21:16:44.450+0000)
>
> of course you do, what dont you understand? you get free rerolls. the average player do not get rerolls after 2, MORE CHANCES

You get rerolls after playing games

you really don't. Because the people in your last game who may or may not use rerolls are new so then its a completely different set of folks who may or may not have and or use rerolls.  Comparing it game to game between accounts, Yes. Very clearly an edge and advantage.

Does it make you magicaly win more games?  No. If your trash at 80% of the champions your still going to be trash in a match. 

RNG is not Pay to win.  Buying a special OP champion that only unlocks from RP?  That's Pay to win.  Starting a game with level 18 and full build because there is a rune that cost $ and allows this? Pay to win.

Learn the term. Advantage and win are not the same. Pay to win HAS to make you win. It cant be luck. It cant be accomplished by free players. The $ needs to be the only requirement for victory and it has to remove the ability of others to contest a match.

Or don't. You can define it how ever you want. Just the ones who have been around when it was coined will disagree with your misusage.

Rerolls is an advantage but Its not inherently pay to win.

I guess it would be even more painful to realize that a game you like is offering a P2W service than it is to bend over backwards to claim that an extra reroll every match doesn't result in more rerolls.

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=0002,timestamp=2019-01-28T21:22:28.669+0000)
>
> I guess it would be even more painful to realize that a game you like is offering a P2W service than it is to bend over backwards to claim that an extra reroll every match doesn't result in more rerolls.

What prompted this comment?

> [{quoted}](name=dnsup,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=hfEnAr69,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2019-01-28T21:51:03.066+0000)
>
> What prompted this comment?

People insisting that a pass that provides more rerolls doesn't have any effect on rerolls (because it doesn't alter the outcome of an individual roll, or because it doesn't increase the max number of rerolls, etc.), even though the singular and direct purpose of such a service is to do exactly that. Players who buy the pass are allowed more attempts at rolling a strong champ than players who don't buy the pass. It is P2W.
